intro: Dobrowskya scabra var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth dobrowskya, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairless, giving it its "glabrata" variety name. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, making it an attractive addition to gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments.
